content: checking that HCD runs against a IODF source file helps minimize the risk of errors before an I/O configuration is activated. HCD support for multiple channel subsystems is available with z/VM and z/OS. HCD provides the capability to make dynamic hardware and software I/O configuration changes. Consult the suitable fix categories: – IBM z16 A01:IBM.Device.Server.IBM z16-3931 – IBM z15 T01: IBM.Device.Server.IBM z15-8561 – IBM z15 T02: IBM.Device.Server.IBM z15-8562 – IBM z14 M0x: IBM.Device.Server.IBM z14-3906 – IBM z14 ZR1: IBM.Device.Server.IBM z14ZR1-3907  HCM HCM is a priced optional feature that supplies a graphical interface of HCD. It is installed on a PC and allows you to manage the physical and logical aspects of a mainframe’s hardware configuration.  CHPID Mapping Tool (CMT) The CMT helps to map CHPIDs onto PCHIDs that are based on an IODF source file and the eConfig configuration file of a mainframe. It provides a CHPID to PCHID mapping with high availability for the
